alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 5:58PM CDT until June 11 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern St. Francis County in eastern Arkansas... Central Crittenden County in eastern Arkansas... Northwestern DeSoto County in northwestern Mississippi... Southwestern Shelby County in west Tennessee... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 557 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Anthonyville, or 10 miles north of Hughes, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Southaven, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Marion, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Walls, Edmondson, Horseshoe Lake, Anthonyville, Jennette, Lake Cormorant, Southwest Memphis, Eudora, Simsboro, Whitehaven, Pinckney, Lynchburg, Crittenden and Trinity. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
